subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Apoptosis and Quality Control Theory
Mitochondrial Dynamics and Longevity Signaling Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial free radicals causing mtDNA and protein damage leading to dysfunction and aging.
Emphasizes ROS-induced mtDNA damage and a vicious cycle of mitochondrial dysfunction driving aging.
Highlights mitochondrial ROS generation, mtDNA mutations, and oxidative stress imbalance as aging drivers.
Focuses on mitochondrial oxidative stress causing mtDNA damage and aging phenotypes.
Describes mitochondria as both source and target of oxidative damage driving aging and apoptosis.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative damage, and MPTP role in aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS production at complex I and oxidative damage as aging causes.
Links mitochondrial dysfunction and mtDNA mutations affecting ROS production and longevity.
Details ROS-driven cardiolipin peroxidation impairing complex I and mitochondrial function.
Focuses on ROS-mediated cardiolipin peroxidation causing complex I dysfunction in aging heart.
Describes accumulation of oxidative mtDNA damage and insufficient repair leading to dysfunction.
Focuses on mtDNA instability and mutation accumulation impairing oocyte mitochondrial function.
Centers on clonal expansion of mtDNA heteroplasmy causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.
Emphasizes somatic mtDNA mutation accumulation and threshold effects driving aging phenotypes.
Highlights high mtDNA mutation rate and accumulation impairing energy production and aging.
Describes mtDNA mutations and deletions accumulating with age causing reproductive senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Apoptosis and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction triggering apoptosis via cytochrome c release and Bcl-2 family regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Apoptosis and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence-associated mitochondrial dysfunction linked to impaired mitophagy and SASP.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Apoptosis and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial dysfunction causally to cellular senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Apoptosis and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial proteostasis via mitoproteases maintaining mitochondrial quality and function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Apoptosis and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial dysfunction, proteostasis, and retrograde signaling contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Apoptosis and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial dynamics, turnover, and mitochondria-nucleus communication in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Apoptosis and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial quality control decline, mitophagy impairment, and mitochondrial-lysosomal axis in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dynamics and Longevity Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial fission/fusion dynamics regulating mitochondrial health and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dynamics and Longevity Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ETC dysfunction activating AMPK-CEH23-CEP1 signaling modulating longevity.
